Package com.oblong.gspeak

The substrate library provides users with an API for building multi-user, gestural interactions in Processing driven by pointing devices such as mobile phones with motion sensing hardware.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
Pointer Class representing a single connected device, and its current pointing state: for example, its location, angle, swipe state.
Substrate Your basic library object that sets up a server for communicating with pointing devices and parses incoming data from those devices.
 

Package com.oblong.gspeak Description

The substrate library provides users with an API for building multi-user, gestural interactions in Processing driven by pointing devices such as mobile phones with motion sensing hardware. The substrate library handles parsing parsing data streams from multiple devices and keeps a collection of Pointer objects that describe each cursor.

The g-speak Pointer application, available in the iTunes store for iOS devices, implements the pointer data protocol that Substrate listens to. Download this app to control pointers with Substrate.

programming with substrate

The Substrate class provides an API for configuring a Processing sketch to parse pointing device data, advertising a server to connect to, and managing a collection of Pointer objects.

To start the substrate server, create a Substrate instance in your sketch's setup method:

Substrate substrate;

void setup () {
  substrate = new Substrate (this);
}

To access the collection of Pointers in the Substrate object, iterate over the values in the pointers map:

for (Pointer p  :  substrate.pointers.values ()) {
  // do something with p
}

Alternatively, your sketch can listen for a variety of events from Pointers.

Pointer events

Using the Pointer.addEventListener(java.lang.Object) method in Pointer, you can subscribe an object to events from a particular Pointer. You can also receive events for all Pointer objects by defining these methods in your sketch.

The Pointer will call the following methods, your sketch or another event listening object that you've set up has methods of the correct name and signature:

    Pointer activity:
  • void pointerAppeared(Pointer p);
  • void pointerVanished(Pointer p);
    Pointer motion:
  • void pointerMoved(Pointer p);
    Pointer intent (soft/hard are normal/double-tap)
  • void pointerSoftened(Pointer p);
  • void pointerHardened(Pointer p);
    Swipe gestures:
  • void pointerSwipedUp(Pointer p);
  • void pointerSwipedDown(Pointer p);
  • void pointerSwipedLeft(Pointer p);
  • void pointerSwipedRight(Pointer p);

Image I/O

substrate also provides an API for uploading images from mobile phones to Processing sketches. The Substrate class provides a method called requestImage(java.lang.String) that sends a message to a mobile device to request an image upload. The listening device presents a UI that allows the user to take a photo. If the user does upload an image, an imageIngested event is created. To listen for image uploads, add the following method to a sketch:

void imageIngested (PImage immy);
